alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 10:45PM MST until December 27 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, light snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Additional snow accumulations generally an inch or two. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible . Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until midnight MST tonight. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft
